meanings.definition: A low, short guttural sound made by an animal or person.
meanings.sent1: The bear let out grunts as it searched for food in the forest.
meanings.sent2: I heard grunts coming from the pig pen at the farm.
meanings.sent3: The grunts of the baby trying to speak were adorable.
meanings.sent4: The grunts of the engine signaled it was struggling to start.
meanings.sent5: The grunts of the old man could be heard across the room.

meanings.definition: A low-ranking soldier in the military.
meanings.sent1: The grunts were responsible for carrying heavy equipment on the battlefield.
meanings.sent2: The grunts lined up for inspection by their commanding officer.
meanings.sent3: The grunts joked about their tough training during break time.
meanings.sent4: The grunts stood like statues in their uniforms.
meanings.sent5: The grunts marched in unison, showing their discipline.

meanings.definition: To make a low, guttural sound.
meanings.sent1: The dog grunts when it wants attention from its owner.
meanings.sent2: I could hear the pig grunt while rooting around in the mud.
meanings.sent3: The engine grunts before finally starting up.
meanings.sent4: She grunts in frustration when lifting the heavy box.
meanings.sent5: The old man grunts as he settles into his chair.
